summary: This is an FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a Bureau of Prisons Unit Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The manager details his interactions with Epstein, the facility's protocols, staffing issues, and the events immediately before and after Epstein was found deceased in his cell on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found deceased in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019. The interview details his housing, his prior suicide attempt in July, his interactions with staff, and his activities the day before his death.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Was the Activities Lieutenant on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death. Lieutenants conduct rounds and report to the Captain.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Was the Operations Lieutenant on August 9, 2019, filling in for another lieutenant on leave. The Operations Lieutenant handles overall issues.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Always works the day watch. Lieutenants report to him. He emailed the interviewee after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: Called the interviewee on August 10 to inform him Epstein had attempted suicide. Later assigned him to guard Epstein's body at the hospital and received his timeline memo.

persons.name: Case Management Coordinator
persons.context: Accompanied the interviewee to the hospital where Epstein's body was held and was responsible for taking Epstein's fingerprints.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: One of the COs guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9. Also one of the COs who was on watch during Epstein's suicide and did not report to work on August 12, requiring a welfare check.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: One of the COs from Internal Affairs who was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: One of the COs from Internal Affairs who was guarding Epstein during his phone call on August 9.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: Was with Epstein's body at the hospital, securing the scene.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: Was with Epstein's body at the hospital, securing the scene.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: Reported that Epstein gave him a thumbs-up during the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count on the night before his death.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: Was seen standing outside the lieutenants' office on August 10 appearing dazed. Was one of the COs on watch during Epstein's suicide.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: One of the COs who did not report to work on August 12, requiring a welfare check conducted by Lieutenant.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: One of the COs who did not report to work on August 12, requiring a welfare check conducted by Lieutenant.

persons.name: Corrections Officer
persons.context: Along with COs and , would have been in a position to know Epstein was without a cellmate based on the August 9-10 assignment rosters.

connections.description: Epstein interacted with the Unit Manager to request help setting up his phone pack and pin, and the manager assisted him with a phone call on August 9.
Lieutenants, including the Activities and Operations Lieutenants, report to Captain.
The Unit Manager reported the timeline of events to AW after Epstein's death and communicated with her via personal phone/email.
CO reported that Epstein gave him a thumbs-up during the 10:00 p.m. stand-up count on August 9.
Both were COs on watch during Epstein's suicide and were among those who did not report to work on August 12.

events.title: Epstein's Previous Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to commit suicide while housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). A doctor subsequently instructed staff that Epstein must always have a cellmate as a result.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call
events.description: Unit Manager assisted Jeffrey Epstein in making a 15-minute phone call from the shower area on the G tier. Epstein called a (347) number and spoke to a male. He was guarded by COs during the call.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC, reportedly slumped over with a noose around his neck. His body was later transported by the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME).

events.title: Welfare Checks on Absent COs
events.description: Lieutenant conducted welfare checks on Corrections Officers and who did not report to work, a procedure typically generated by the warden.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
FBI-New York offices, 290 Broadway, New York, New York
MCC hospital on Park Row (separate from main building)
keyFacts: Epstein was supposed to always have a cellmate following a suicide attempt in July 2019, but this order was communicated verbally, not in writing, and there was no visual reminder system in the SHU office.
On the night before his death, Epstein's cellmate had not returned from court, leaving him alone in his cell, a fact several assigned COs would have been positioned to know.
The MCC's video surveillance system was not functioning properly at the time of Epstein's death, though staff operated under the assumption it was working.
The Unit Manager assisted Epstein with a phone call on August 9, 2019, and described Epstein as being in a good mood and happy after the call.
After Epstein's death, OCME officials and MCC staff used a decoy (boxes and sheets made to look like a body) to divert the press and allow Epstein's body to be transported unnoticed.
